parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma2
</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00
</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Roads and Airports

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Checks if given position is inside road segment. Same as [[roadAt]], only return is boolean instead of road object.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''isOnRoad''' position

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> position: [[Object]] or [[Array]] in format [[PositionAGL]] (especially on bridges) or (since Arma 3 v1.99.146460) [[Position2D]], in which case Z will be automatically deduced as the height of the road surface

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Boolean]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_objOnRoad = [[isOnRoad]] [[player]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_posOnRoad = [[isOnRoad]] [[ASLToAGL]] [[getPosASL]] [[player]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[nearRoads]], [[roadsConnectedTo]], [[roadAt]], [[surfaceIsWater]], [[getRoadInfo]], [[nearestTerrainObjects]]
</value></part></template>


<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma2</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>tkoh</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>
[[Category:Scripting Commands|<template><title>uc:<template><title>PAGENAME</title></template></title></template>]]

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on November 24, 2017 - 21:31 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Tankbuster|Tankbuster]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Some roadobjects will return false when using this command. invisibleroadway_square_f.p3d is found by the nearRoads command, yet will return false for isOnRoad.
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
